intro: Iris issica, commonly known as the purple flag iris, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the Iridaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its leaves are sword-shaped and form a dense rosette at the base. Iris issica prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy addition to temperate climates.
